list.item: Description of my room in the Teachers' Cottage with diagram -

p.del: Dearest family - It's four o'clock this warm Sunday afternoon and I wonder what all you many be doing and whether fair Mabel is still in you midst - Have decided that the best name for her is Mabel - the maiden of mystery!

My writing looks worse than usual doesn't it - but have been writing a lot these last two days and guess that's the reason - Finally got my Pi Phi letter off to Lida yesterday - Emily went to Sevierville and mailed it there - wrote Charlotte a long one & am in the middle of one to Jo - a note to Bessie - Ruth D. - a letter to the Cavanagh's - note to Emily's cousin who selected the khakhi middy for me - and another to the company in Knoxville who have done my developing &
printing with which will have to go a money order - then am sending some more films to another company with order for film packs - It seems to me some of my pictures are printed too dark when I ask them to be duplicated. So thought I'd try a new place.

div1.p: It's getting dark & sultry - every indication of a storm - downstairs the Junior B.Y.P. is gathering with Emily - Evelyn is reading in her room - Aunt Lizzie & Mrs. Profit are hobnobbing together somewhere - Mrs. Profit spends the week ends here as her boys & Mr. C. go Friday night - Abbie is usually with us as her girls also depart but she departed herself for Sevierville after school Friday.

Have not had a letter since the beginning of the week a longer lapse of time than usual but know that you all have been busy - even pa was roped into the party no doubt. Saw the notice of it in the paper! Truly I wont know how to act in the city after while! Before I forget in my rambling along - let me tell you that the paper bag is a great boon and has already made over night trips with me - Emily & I took it for the trip to Maud Clabo's house and then I took it Friday night when I went over & stayed with Mary Ogle. It's so convenient to carry and holds so much. We will enjoy it for picnics I'm sure - for can fold it up after we
get through eating. The bundle of papers came & was pleased to find my quarterly and the booklets. Aunt Lizzie enjoyed them so much the afternoon they came - that the same evening when Emily & I were at Maud's she got them out to show them to Dr. Massey & Evelyn. Thank you very much for your sweet thoughtfulness. Line drawing of Ruth Sturley's room in the Teachers' Cottage. How do you like my room? On the table is a green blotting pad - books - writing paper etc. and here I spend most of my time when in this place (except when I sleep). The dressing table is just a plain table like the study table but with my bureau scarf silver things - pa's & Jane's pictures
and a mirror above its not so bad as it might be. On the left of the mirror is Weirs smiling face & on the other side Arthur & Nell - with the little California picture Victoria gave me. On the be Chiffonier is the picture of the two youngsters and Charlotte's - my lamb work basket etc. On the window seat is a growing collection of papers etc. The walls are plain wood like the floor - pine I believe - no rugs as yet. Am clad in my pongee old white shoes - my hair is somewhat fuzzy having been washed yesterday & I'm brown also fatter than when we parted! Truly I eat something fierce! This morning had two cups of coffee - 4 hot baking powder biscuits & much apple jelly. For dinner we had fried chicken - boiled rice which took
the place of potatoes (sing. potato!) and is exceedingly good with the chicken gravy - baked apples - more hot biscuits - cake and orange & bananna sliced together. Aunt Lizzie has been making apple jelly & apple butter all week and yesterday they got a bushel and a half of pears - which she is going to can - They are not particularly good - rather small and green.

As usual it's been a busy time since I wrote you Thursday night. Stayed at school till about 4:30 putting up some pictures in my room - cleaning out my desk - getting down some cobwebs - supervising the cleaning of the three little girls. We also cleaned out the fireplace. All the garbage & waste paper is burned there so
that it was full to overflowing. They ought to have some garbage cans it seems to me. A Mr. Lawson Reagan came over to fix the clock in my room which had been out of commission most of the week - my little alarm clock sat on the piano over there all day Friday - Mabel will be pleased to hear this she was so fond of that singing instrument! Mr. Reagan is the father of Flora in my 8th B Class and a typical mountaineer - am hoping to get his picture some time! He is one of the pillars in the church (though a very short one) and leads the singing - Stands by the organ & beats time while we all sit in the choir seats facing him & sing sing sing - Rescue the penshing etc. Some of the hymns aren't bad though. - There are not books enough for every-
one - so the audience never sings - just "we uns!"

Well to return to after school Friday - I also had Mr. Reagan fix the front door which has a spring for holding one side open which also had been out of commission most of the week - Just as I was ready to leave Miss Turner (our Pi Phi) and a Mrs. Hall arrived from the hotel. Miss Turner wished to get a book and by that time Mr. R. was through and decided to take two - He wanted Pilgrim's Progress which he said he'd read a long time ago and took "The Blue Bird" along with it. Miss T. selected one of Mrs. Burnett's books - She is very nice but a typical old maid in many ways - is enraptured with everything here however. They went off and I got home & comfortably settled on the porch with
something to read & an apple - Emily & Evelyn were both gone to Sevierville & Pigeon Forge - when Mrs. Huff appeared with her sister-in-law and stayed the rest of the afternoon winding up with a visit at the school - Her sister lives in a small town near Knoxville and hadn't been in our school before. Soon the girls came home and during supper - Mary Ogle blew in begging one of us to go and stay all night with her. You know her husband is getting a divorce from her - through the evil influence of a Mrs. Brown in the mts. nearby who It's a long & involved story and I do not know all the details fortunately but know enough about it to feel rather wrathy when the Pi Phis and school are blackened! You see Evelyn discharged Marshall her Mary's husband & his
people and he are trying to revenge themselves on the school by attacking reputations of some of the Pi Phis who taught here several years ago - and Evelyn's - I've discussed it with her and she thinks now about it as I do that the thing to do is give them a good scare & settle this gossip for good and all by going to a lawyer. The Ogle family live just below Mary's and when Marshall is in town & then she is afraid. There really is nothing to be afraid of - and I was there Friday night - we found out later that the minister was at the Ogles' that night and that they told these things to him - He comes up once a month for services Saturday p.m. & Sunday - So yesterday (Sat.) about 2:30 was church. It was rumored around that several people were going to be turned out of church too. I had had a busy morning (my first Sat. here
all day too - ) writing but bustled around with my both hairwashing manicuring etc. & was clothed in my gray garb & best hat by the time the last church bell rang & on my way to church with Evelyn - It was a very peaceful meetin' as far as any dismissals were concerned - though the minister talked very plainly about "the capers the devil had been cuttin up" & "haw people had been rarin' around" saying things behind the back & not "square to the teeth" etc. His expressions were so funny but he was very much in earnest.

Evelyn went right to him after church & had it out with him - He was very much - and as two or three pillars were there it was quite a clearing of the atmosphere. You see like all small places there seems to be one family who
try to stir up trouble & this particular Ogle family is the one here. Evelyn goes to a lawyer in Sevierville this week - Judge Paine a personal friend of hers - and as it happens Marshall's lawyer - isn't that rich?

Well to continue after church I came home & planned to go up Pi Phi lane & make another attempt to read having been failed the previous afternoon - But failed again was the word for Miss Turner appeared and so we went for a walk up Pi Phi lane on to Baskin's Creek returning about six. Then while supper was being prepared we called on Mary Ogle as Miss T. wanted to see the house - She stayed the rest of the evening & we took her back to the hotel about nine. It was a perfect night
balmy and the moon nearly full - I know the moon is much brighter than ours at home - the last Geographic has an interesting article on stars which I read after we finally tore ourselves away from the porch - Emily went to bed and Evelyn sat down & played & sang at the piano - She has a lovely contralto voice. Was up at six this lovely morning & donned my walking costume as Miss Turner wanted to go up Tom Camel's trail and we planned to start about seeight getting out of sight before the gathering for Sunday School. I had a feeling she wouldn't go somehow & was not surprised when a small boy arrived about 8:30 with a note saying she couldn't & would
explain later - She was on the verge of a nervous breakdown when she came so do not think hard walks are her line exactly. I was in the midst of various activities & decided to keep right on and not go to any church function till tonight. Emily & Evelyn went and were gone three long hours!! I cleaned my shoes changed my bed - straightened out my top drawer - scoured the stationary wash stands with Dutch cleanser - changed my dress - wrote letters - fixed my tan dress that Bessie made and of course did some washing!! So now you know just about all that has been doing up to the present moment! Will close for now & will try to get off another letter the middle of the week - Hoping to hear from some of you tomorrow & with much of love as always - Ruth.
